snippet: The court did, however, leave in place many of the orders by Judge Nicholas G. Garaufis, including a finding that previous tests used to screen applicants had been biased against minorities.
abstract: Federal appeals court in Manhattan rules that district court judge, Nicholas G Garaufis, presiding over a long-running lawsuit against New York Fire Department claiming discrimination against minority applicants went too far in forcing the department to revamp its hiring process; also says that he had raised enough doubts about his impartiality to require assigning a key part of the case to another judge.

byline.original: By MOSI SECRET and BENJAMIN WEISER

lead_paragraph: The court did, however, leave in place many of the orders by Judge Nicholas G. Garaufis, including a finding that previous tests used to screen applicants had been biased against minorities.

headline.seo: Appeals Court Says Judge Went Too Far in Forcing Fire Dept. to Revamp Its Hiring
